resources.string: To run the ADB hack you will need a Windows/Linux PC or a Mac, plus Google\'s ADB tool which can be downloaded from the following link: %s
Once a working connection has been established run the following command from the terminal/command line on your computer.
To use this feature you must enable the MacroDroid accessibility option in your settings.

The following features are enabled with accessibility:\10Auto press back button.\10Auto expand/collapse status bar.\10Launch Android UI dialogs such as power off dialog.\10Detect current active app.\10\10All these features can be utilised by a disabled person (for example blind or limited motor skills) to create simple automations to make using their device easier.

This accessibility service allows MacroDroid to detect fingerprint gestures.\10\10Note that only a single app can have access to fingerprint gestures. Enabling this option will also disable the built in swipe up and down gestures for showing/hiding the notification panel.
This accessibility service allows MacroDroid to perform simple UI interactions.
This accessibility service allows MacroDroid to detect volume button presses.\10\10MacroDroid will NEVER read your key presses or text that you type, it will only detect volume button key presses.
To use this feature you must enable the MacroDroid fingerprint gesture accessibility option in your settings.

This service is required for the Finger Print Gesture trigger to function (on the subset of devices that support this). The accessibility service will notify MacroDroid when specific gestures are performed (e.g. swipe up) on the fingerprint sensor.\10\10MacroDroid can access no information about your fingerprints and the accessibility service exposes no information other than a direction of swipe on the sensor.

This service is required to enable a variety of MacroDroid features as listed below:\10\10App Launched/Closed trigger\10Recent Apps Trigger\10Android Shortcut action\10Press Back action\10Screen Off Action\10Take ScreenShot action.\10\10To perform this functionality MacroDroid will be able to monitor which app you have open in the foreground. This information is never and will never be stored or used in any way other than to perform the functionality listed above.

This service is used to perform basic automated UI clicks. In order for this to work MacroDroid will read the contents of your screen\'s UI hierarchy to identify the correct view to click on etc.\10\10The contents of your screen are never and will never be stored or saved in any way and are used solely for the purpose as described.

This service is required for the Volume Press trigger to function. This service works by filtering key press events to detect volume up and volume down key presses.\10\10MacroDroid does not and will never read any other key presses or in any way persist or store any information regarding keys that you have pressed.

MacroDroid will never store any data obtained via accessibility services on your device and never send any such data outside of the app in any way. To ensure your privacy, MacroDroid will never include third party libraries or services that utilise the MacroDroid accessibility services in any way.
MacroDroid uses Android accessibility services to perform various functionality on your device as described below.
MacroDroid uses accessibility features to help disabled users get the most from their phone
To use this feature you must enable the MacroDroid UI Interaction accessibility option in your settings.
To use this feature you must enable the MacroDroid volume button monitor accessibility option in your settings.
This action can be used to enable or disable any accessibility service that is present on your device.
An action block is a simple way to group multiple actions into a single re-usable block. The action block can then be added to your macros as a single item.
This action allows you to log an event to your calendar at a time relative to when the macro is invoked.
The first time you run this action, you may be prompted to choose the application to handle it. Hit the always option when choosing the app, to make it run automatically in the future.

This action allows you to set an alarm for your alarm clock application.\10\10Note that this action relies on sending intents to your Alarm Clock application so it relies on the Alarm Clock correctly handling these intents. Not all clock apps handle these intents, so in this case the action will not function.
This action allows you to enable or disable the notification LED.
This action allows you to turn on/off ambient display mode.
This action allows you to launch a shortcut to standard Android OS features.
Could not connect to Android Wear device

This action can be used to create an Android Wear notification, open an application, vibrate or configure your Android Wear device.\10\10This feature requires the MacroDroid Android Wear companion app to be installed on the watch.\10\10To install the companion app open the Play Store app on the watch and select \'Apps on your phone\'
This action will auto answer an incoming call.\10\10You can specify a delay period before the call is answered.
This action allows you to turn on/off battery saver mode.
Sorry, %s is currently not supported in action blocks.
Invalid Control flow. All condition and loop elements must be included fully.

An action block is a reusable list of actions that can be called from multiple macros (or other action blocks).\10\10Each action block has optional input and output parameters that may be used to send custom values in and receive result values out.
The action block name already exists
This action can be used to turn on/off bluetooth tethering.
This action will immediately break out of the current loop and run the next action after the loop.\10\10If this action is placed outside of a loop then it will be ignored.

This action will turn on/off the camera flash light so the device can act as a torch.\10\10Note that some devices wont allow the camera flash to function without a foreground app, in this case you should select the Foreground App option.
This action will cancel any not yet executed actions that are pending for a macro that is in the process of running
This action allows you to put the device into or out of Car Mode. Note that Car Mode is a standard Android feature but may not do anything depending on your device.
This action will modify the currently selected default keyboard.
This action is used to clear cache and user data for the selected application(s).
This action will clear the call log. You can select to clear logs for a specific contact or all contacts.
This action can be used to delete individual entries within a dictionary or array variable.
This action allows you to clear the MacroDroid user or system log.
This action will clear all notifications from the notification bar.

This action can be used to clear multiple variables to an empty state.\10\10Strings variables will be set to an empty string.\10\10Numerical variables will be set to zero.\10\10Boolean variables will be set to false.
This action will fill the clipboard buffer with the specified text.
If you experience problems with this action please ensure you have BusyBox installed (Available from Google Play).
This action can be used to close an application that is running on the device.
This action enables you turn on/off notifications for other applications.
Do you want to run the actions?
Do you want to run the macro?
This action will display a confirmation dialog that will allow you to run or cancel the execution of subsequent actions.

This action can be used to check for internet connectivity and store the current connected state in a boolean variable.\10\10By default this action will block subsequent actions until it completes, so you may safely check the state of the variable after this action.
This action can be used to call one of your contacts via a specific app.
This action will skip any subsequent actions within the loop and revert back to the start of the loop.\10\10If this action is placed outside of a loop then it will be ignored.
Please note that in many cases the desired app must first be launched/in the foreground.\10\10It is recommended to precede this action with a launch application and wait before next action.

This action can be used to play/pause and skip to the previous or next track in the media player.\10\10Controlling media is not officially supported in Android, therefore two alternative mechanisms are provided. The first mode simulates media button presses and the second mode should control the default media player.
This action can be used to enable/disable the dark theme on Android 10+.
Daydream mode cannot be started on this device
This action allows you to put the device into Daydream mode.
This action can be used to delete a macro. You can use it as the last action within a macro to make a single use self destroying macro.
Forces the status bar into a fixed state useful for taking screenshots with a consistent status bar state. This option usually appears in developer options in the device settings.
This action adds a dark overlay to your screen to enable variable levels of dimming.
This action can be used to enable or disable an app on a rooted device.
This action can be used to enable/disable all macros within a category.
This action can be used to enable/disable other Macros within MacroDroid.
This action can be used to turn off/disable MacroDroid as if switching off from the home screen.
This action can be used in a macro where you only want to track triggers firing via the system log.
This action can be used to allow/prevent other applications accessing the camera.
This action can be called from within an action block to force an immediate exit from the action block.
This action can be used to drop down or hide away the status bar showing any current notifications.
This action can be used to export the current MacroDroid system or user log to a file on your device.
This action can be used to export your current macro list.
This action can be used to copy, move or delete files from the device.\10\10Note that copying/moving large files can cause the device to lag while the operation is in progress.
This action can be used to copy, move or delete files from the device.\10\10Note that copying/moving large files can cause the device to lag while the operation is in progress.
This action can be used to modify the location and other properties of a floating button.
This action can be used to display an overlay containing customisable text that can updated dynamically.
This action can be used to scale the font at a system level and corresponds to the Font Size settings in a typical device\'s Display settings.
This action will force a one off location update.\10\10This action should be used to force any Location Triggers to immediately inspect the current location.
This action can be used to force a Macro to run. It can run a specific macro or present a pop up for you to select a macro to run.

This action allows you to force the screen to lock in a particular orientation (landscape/portrait).\10\10Please note that this works by adding a screen overlay so you must use another action to cancel any set forced rotation.
This action allows you to forward an incoming SMS message to a chosen contact.
This action allows you to enable or disable heads-up notifications on your device.
This action can be used to make HTTP requests to a server end-point.
This action can be used to run one or more actions only if the condition is met.
This action makes it possible to run the actions in the If clause only when confirmed in the shown dialog box.\10\10When denied the actions in the If clause will skipped.
This action allows you to configure the immersive mode of your device.
This action allows you to set the global colour inversion setting on the device.

This action is a specialized type of loop that can be used to iterate over all elements within a dictionary/array.\10\10The current dictionary key/array index can be obtained within the loop using the following magic text strings:\10\10[iterator_dictionary_key]\10[iterator_array_index]\10\10The current dictionary/array value can be obtained with the following magic text:\10\10[iterator_value]
This action can be used to generate JSON formatted output based on the content of a dictionary or array variable.\10\10The output JSON text is stored into a String variable.
This action can be used to parse JSON formatted text stored in a string variable.\10\10It will output the equivalent data structure into a dictionary variable.
This action can be used to force the device to stay awake for a fixed period of time.\10\10You can choose to keep the screen on/dim or allow the screen to be off but keep the CPU alive.
This action may not work on all devices as some manufacturers prevent background apps from doing this. In these cases it is recommended to use the Set Screen Timeout action as an alternative.

This action can be used to close an application that is running in the background on the device.\10\10Please be aware that this action is limited to killing dormant background processes rather than applications that are actively doing something in the background.
The application could not be started
This action can be used to launch an application that is installed on the device.

This action can be used to launch an application that is installed on the device and then replay a series of touch events.\10\10After you select the application it will launch and it will start recording your touch events.\10\10When you have finished recording your events press the power button to stop recording.

Please be aware that this action requires a rooted device, is very experimental and it may not function at all on some devices.\10\10Note that screen swipes are handled very poorly, where possible you should stick to simple touch actions.\10\10For instructions on how to use this action please go back and long press the action.
This action will launch the home screen.
The application could not be started
This action can be used to launch a shortcut that is available on the device.
This action allows you to launch a locale compatible plugin that can perform settings/actions.
Adds an event to the MacroDroid user log.\10\10The user log can be viewed by pressing the menu button on the MacroDroid home screen.

This action can be used to repeat one or more other actions. It will repeat either a fixed number of times, or only while a certain condition is met.\10\10In many cases it will be sensible to use a wait before next within the loop to prevent very rapid firing of lots of actions.
This action can be used to open, close, enable or disable the MacroDroid drawer.

This action can be used to customize the text that is displayed in the persistent MacroDroid notification.\10\10Note that this text is not displayed when the notification is configured to show a button bar.
This action can be used to change a MacroDroid application setting.
Show Notification Button Bar (No longer used)
This action can be used to place an outgoing call to someone in your contacts list.
This action can be used to display a pop up message dialog with subject, message and notification sound of your choice.

To use this feature you must allow MacroDroid to have device administration permissions.\10\10* IMPORTANT PLEASE READ *\10\10If you enable device admin access you will not be able to uninstall MacroDroid normally. Instead you will first have to disable device admin via your device\'s Settings app (Security options), or just use the uninstall option from the drawer menu on the macrodroid home screen.\10\10Select OK to go to the device admin page on your device.
This action can be used to display a standard Android notification with subject, message and icon of your choice.
This action allows you to automatically interact with an existing notification. You can auto click the content, or one of the actions that may be exposed on a notification.
This action will open the call log.
This action allows you to open a file within an application that can handle the file type.
This action will open the last photo taken in an appropriate application.
This action will open the MacroDroid system or user log.
This action can be used to launch the browser to open a particular web page or to invoke an HTTP GET request (no web page will open).
Save HTTP response in string variable
Save call success state in boolean variable
This action will present a user configured dialog with up to 3 options which can invoke other macros.
This action will cause a delay before invoking the next action in the action list.
This action can be used to perform a range of actions on a Pebble watch.
This action allows you to play/stop a sound of your choice.\10\10You can either select one of your device\'s standard notifcation sounds, or alternatively specify a file stored on your device.
This action allows you to invoke a press of the back button.
This action can be used to read the contents of a text file into a String variable
This action will reboot or power off the device.\10\10Note that Root access is required for this action to function.
This action will record from the device\'s microphone for the chosen duration.\10\10You may either select a specific duration or record indefinitely until a \'Cancel Recording\' action is invoked.
This action will reject an incoming call.
This action can be used to restore persistent notifications that have been hidden by a previous call to clear notifications.

This action will say the current time using the selected audio stream (configurable in application settings).\10\10Note that this feature requires text to speech libraries that may no be present on the device. In this case you should go to the Google Play store to download the libraries.
Screen Off failed - is MacroDroid enabled as a device administrator?

This action will turn the screen on/off.\10\10Due to an Android limitation using screen off on a non-rooted device (prior to Android 9) will not allow unlock via fingerprint.\10\10Screen on (alternative) should be used on devices where the standard screen on action doesn\'t function.
Secure Settings is a third party application that can be used to configure a wide range of system settings.\10\10You can install Secure Settings from Google Play.
This action can be used to invoke an action in the Secure Settings application.\10\10Secure Settings is a third party application which allows you to invoke numerous actions on your device.
This action allows you to send an email message to a specific address.
This action can be used to invoke an Android Intent.\10\10This feature is for advanced users who understand the details of the intent they wish to invoke.
This action allows you to send an SMS message to a chosen contact.

This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle the Airplane mode.\10\10Note that root access is required to invoke this function unless you make MacroDroid the default assist app (Android 7+ only), which then enables appropriate access to set Airplane mode.
This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle the automatic screen rotation feature.
This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle automatic background data syncing.
This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle Bluetooth. It also supports the ability to connect to a specific Bluetooth audio device (not currently available on 4.2+).
You have no audio devices paired. Please pair with a suitable Bluetooth device and try again.
This action is used to set the brightness level of the device.

This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle the mobile data connection.\10\10Note that the ADB hack (non-rooted) may not function on some devices and/or you may only be able to Toggle mobile data on/off via MacroDroid. System controls (such as Quick Toggle tile) may cease to function.

This action allows you to set the device\'s current default digital assistant.\10\10This will (for example) allow you to switch dynamically between the Google default assistant and some other app when required.\10\10Note that the currently selected default digital assistant may not update correctly in the settings on some devices (but this should not effect the functionality).
This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle the GPS hardware. On Android 5.0+ please use the Set Location Mode action instead.
This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle mobile HotSpot.
This action will display a prompt to switch the currently selected keyboard.

This action is used to turn the screen lock (for example the pin code entry screen) on or off.\10\10This action may have issues on some device running Android 4.0+. If you experience issues please try the Secure Settings action as an alternative.

Please be aware that this action may not work reliably on all devices.\10\10On some Android 4.0+ devices selecting a notification while the screen lock is disabled will result in the screen lock being displayed.\10\10Give it a try and see if it works for you!
Set the language of the device.
This action allows you to configure the device\'s current location mode.
This action is used to set the current location update rate.\10\10Location updates will take place when you have one or more macros configured that use the Location Trigger.
This action can be used to change the persistent MacroDroid icon displayed in the notification bar.
This action is used to set the current MacroDroid \'Mode\'.\10\10The current MacroDroid mode can be used as a constraint to restrict when other triggers can fire.
This action allows you to turn on/off or toggle NFC.
This action can be used to change the image of a button within the MacroDroid notification button bar.
This action is used to set the device\'s standard notification sound for incoming notifications.
This action is used to set the device\'s priority mode on Android 5.0+ devices.
This action is used to set a toggleable quick setting tile to the on/off state. It can also be used to update the icon and label of the quick settings tile.
This action is used to set the device\'s standard ringtone for incoming calls.
Please note that setting a value < 15 seconds will not work reliably on some devices.
This action is used to set the length of time that will elapse before the screen turns off when the device is idle.
This action allows you to set the value of a specific MacroDroid variable.
This action enables you to set the device into or out of vibrate mode.\10\10When the device is set into vibrate mode all calls and notifications will be muted.
This action is used to set the volume level of one or more audio streams on the device.
This action is used to set the device\'s wallpaper to a specific image.
This action allows you to turn on/off/toggle Wifi, connect to a specific Wifi network.\10\10On Android 10+ this feature now requires the use of the MacroDroid helper APK to be installed.

This action allows you to share your current location via SMS, Facebook, Twitter, Email, Calendar or a MacroDroid variable.\10\10Note that this action will take an indeterminate amount of time to obtain a position fix. You can configure various aspects of this action (such as the retry period) in the MacroDroid settings.
This action can be used to run a custom shell script command on rooted devices.

This action allows you to set the device into silent mode with vibration for calls/notifications disabled.\10\10It is an alternative to Set Priority/Do Not Disturb mode and works better on some devices such as Samsungs where vibration can still remain enabled when trying to mute the phone.

This action will speak the entered text using the selected audio stream. The MacroDroid default value is configurable in application settings.\10\10Note that this feature requires text to speech libraries that may not be present on the device. In this case you should go to the Google Play store to download the libraries.

Please note that this action will not function on many devices running Android 10+.\10\10I am not currently aware of any workaround or alternative implementation. If you are aware of any another app that can perform this function on your device then please let me know at support@macrodroid.com.
This action will turn on/off the speaker phone functionality. Please note this action will only work if used while a call is active.
A Stopwatch with that name already exists

This action can be used to start, stop or reset a stopwatch timer. The value of a stop watch timer may be used in expressions and assigned to variables so it can be utilised in other triggers/constraints as required.
This action can be used to force a sync of an account on the device.

This action allows you to change a global system setting from the device\'s system, secure or global settings table.\10\10**Warning** This action could be potentially dangerous if you don\'t know what you are doing. Not all settings will apply to all devices and may change with OS version updates etc.\10\10Note that to edit secure or global settings you will need a rooted device or ADB hack to grant permission.

This action will take a picture using the device\'s camera.\10\10On devices with front and rear cameras you will be prompted to select which camera to use.\10\10All photos taken will be saved on your sdcard /MacroDroid/photos directory.

This action will take a screenshot (rooted devices only). Implementation details can vary on different devices, so there are a number of mechanisms available to try.\10\10The screenshot will be saved in /sdcard/MacroDroid/Screenshots.
This action will take a screenshot using the accessibility service. It may optionally be shared via email or via an Intent to prompt for app selection.
Could not write to external storage
This action can be used to perform basic string manipulation on a text string.
This action will display a pop up message with text of your choice.\10\10This action supports basic HTML such as BOLD and ITALIC
This action can be used to simulate a single finger press at a location on the screen.
Note that duplicated tweets may be rejected by Twitter. You can add variable values such as the current hour and minute to make static text more unique.
This action can be used to send a tweet to twitter.
This action can be used to send a UDP command to a remote server.

This action can be used to perform basic UI interactions with other apps, such as clicks and gestures (Android 7+) using Android\'s accessibility service.\10\10Please be aware that any macros that use this action may be fragile and subject to breaking if for example the UI of an application is updated in the future.\10\10Note that this action cannot function when the screen is off.
This action can be used to uninstall an existing app from the device.

This action can be used on Android 10+ devices to let the app know the current contents of the clipboard.\10\10It is no longer possible on Android 10+ to read the clipboard content from a background app so this action will create a temporary invisible overlay to read the contents of the clipboard into MacroDroid.

This action will upload the last photo taken with the device\'s camera to either Twitter or a specified email address.\10\10Note that you can configure various aspects of this action (such as the retry period) in the MacroDroid settings.

This action can be used to turn on/off USB tethering on rooted devices (that support USB tethering). This will only have an effect if you have a suitable USB connection established at the time of invoking.
This action will cause the device to vibrate to the chosen pattern.
This action allows you to prompt for voice input and save the recognized text into a string variable.
This action allows you to start the voice search feature of your device.
This action can be used to increment or decrement the currently active volume stream.

This action can be used to suspend subsequent actions from running until one of the specified triggers fires.\10\10If the same trigger is set on this action and the parent macro, then this action will take priority next time the trigger is invoked and the subsequent actions will resume.

This action can be used to send messages in WhatsApp to individual contacts only (no groups).\10\10Please note that this action requires the device to be unlocked and the screen to be on as it relies on faking UI interactions to send the message in WhatsApp.
This action can be used to modify the icon/text of a custom widget button
This action can be used to write/append text to a file.
The frequency that the device will update activity recognition. More frequent updates may cause higher battery drain.
For instructions on connecting your device via ADB please see the following link: %s
For further details/discussion check the forum link below.
In order to use this feature your device must be rooted or you must perform an ADB hack, click ok for details on how to perform the ADB hack.
When adding a new macro from the macro list you will be taken through all steps to build a new macro.

All MacroDroid notifications are currently disabled. It is strongly recommended to disable only the persistent notification channel to avoid missing important notifications such as configuration error warnings.
MacroDroid is already default assist app
Please only select this option if you have already enabled MacroDroid as the default assist app.

If you have already purchased the pro upgrade via Google Play and it has not applied, firstly please ensure you have installed from the same Google account as your purchase.\10\10Then please try rebooting your device, ensure you have a good internet connection and open MacroDroid and the update should apply.

Android now has additional restrictions on file access. Some macros that interact with files may need to be reconfigured to continue working.\10\10Please check the troubleshooting section in the drawer menu for any macros that are identified as needing fixing.
Sorry you have too many apps installed and an Android limitation prevents me from obtaining a full list :-(
Some Android 9+ devices use a different mapping of percentage to brightness. Try enabling this option if brightness does not work correctly on your device.
If you experience a problem with this trigger, please go into the apps trigger settings and select the alternative mechanism for this trigger.
Enable this option if you experience problems with the application launched trigger not working
This application is not licensed nor valid. Please download the app from a trusted source.
Are you sure you wish to clear all log entries?
Are you sure you wish to delete this action block?
This category is currently used, are you sure you wish to delete it?
Are you sure you wish to delete the cell tower?
Are you sure you wish to delete the cell tower group?
Are you sure you wish to delete this comment?
Are you sure you wish to delete this Macro?
Are you sure you wish to delete this variable?
Are you sure you wish to remove all action blocks?
Are you sure you wish to remove all macros?
Are you sure you wish to sign out?
Automatically send an sms when removing the headphones on a weekday morning.
I have just arrived at the office
%s audio stream - Volume is currently zero
Authentication failed, click here to re-authenticate.
Auto answer any incoming call when connected to a bluetooth device.

MacroDroid will by default keep daily backups of your macro configurations for the last %1$d days.\10\10You can enable/disable this functionality here and restore from any backup listed below.\10\10Note that any backups stored here will be lost if MacroDroid is uninstalled, therefore it is recommended to keep your own external backups.
Auto translate foreign templates to English
Tap here to choose an avatar image (or leave as the default if you prefer)
In order to use this feature MacroDroid must be granted permission to always allow access to location.

Background location permission has not been granted to MacroDroid (required on Android 11+). Please try and enable this below.\10\10If the enable button does not work, please use the settings link and then manually navigate to permissions->location and select the allow all the time option.
Backup file could not be restored
Please visit www.dontkillmyapp.com/%s and configure your device

%1$s devices do not typically allow apps to run in the background unless correctly configured.\10\10Please see http://dontkillmyapp.com/%2$s for information on how to configure your device. You can find this link later in the drawer menu on the home page.
Use your biometric or screen lock to continue
You have blocked this user, so all macros and comments by them are hidden.
* = not identified as an audio device, so the action may not function.
Some devices (particularly Xiaomi) do not map brightness to a percentage scale. Use this option to force a particular brightness value that can be greater than 100.
Calibration Failed. Please close this dialog and reload the action to try again.
Cannot add constraint - infinite recursion detected
Can\'t launch accessibility settings directly, please load via your device\'s settings
Can\'t launch notification settings directly, please load via your device\'s settings
Can\'t launch settings directly, please load via your device\'s settings
You cannot star your own macros
Capturing logcat messages, hit stop when done
Configure the Device to Car Mode when it is placed in a car dock.
Configure the Device to Standard Mode when it is removed from a car dock.

To help organise and group related macros, each one can be placed into a category. The current list of categories is shown below and the number in brackets shows how many macros are currently in that category.\10\10Click on an existing category to delete or rename it and use the plus button to add a new category.
By default all triggers, actions and constraints now appear in categories. You can disable this via the overflow menu to restore the classic list view.
The cell tower group has been edited, do you wish to save the changes?
The frequency of cell tower updates that occur when a cell tower trigger is configured. More frequent updates may cause higher battery drain.

Groups of cell towers can be used to define geographical areas. Using the Cell tower trigger, a macro can be invoked when entering or leaving this area. Cell tower groups can also be used as a constraint.\10\10Using cell towers is generally more battery efficient than Geofences, however the accuracy is much worse so is only suitable for large areas.
Please check your connection and try again
Please check your internet connection before retrying
Choose an option from the values below.
Clear alarm failed, your system has no app that can handle the AlarmClock.ACTION_DISMISS_ALARM intent
Are you sure you wish to clear all entry values?

This is often due to a problem with the Play Store app which can be resolved by clearing the app and cache data of the Play Store app.\10\10Click ok to go the Play Store info page where you can clear the data from the Storage & Cache options.\10\10It is also recommend to reboot your device after clearing the data.
MacroDroid is not currently set as the default app to handle a long press. Press ok to go to the app settings page for %1$s and select the clear defaults option
This will clear all reports for this macro.
Click to configure gmail for MacroDroid
Click OK to upgrade to the pro version.
Sorry this feature can no longer work in Android 10+ as the functionality has been killed by Google.
An alternative workaround uses the MacroDroid UI Interaction accessibility service to try and detect when new content appears in the clipboard.

Standard clipboard access is not possible on Android 10+ unless you have a rooted device with appropriate Magisk modules. As a workaround MacroDroid can monitor the devices logcat output to try and detect when new content appears in the clipboard.
Cloud Backup did not complete - please try again later
This feature requires Google Play services to function.
Please sign in to enable cloud backup functionality.
Cloud backup is a pro only feature that allows you to automatically save your macros to the cloud.
Please upgrade to the pro version to add comments.
Please sign in with an account to add comments.

This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when a specific application is/is not the foreground active application.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the airplane mode is enabled/disabled.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when auto rotate is enabled/disabled.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when auto sync mode is enabled/disabled.

This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the battery level is greater than or less than the specified value.\10\10Note that some devices may not report every change but may only report in intervals such as 5 or 10 percent.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent something running based on the battery saver state of the device.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent a macro running based on the current temperature of the device\'s battery.

This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the Bluetooth connection is in a specific state.\10\10You can specify that either the Bluetooth is on or off, or alternatively that a particular device is/is not connected.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent a macro running based on the current brightness setting of the device.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when a calendar entry for the current time is set/not set.
This constraint can be used to allow something to happen only when the specified category is enabled or disabled.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when a cell tower is in/not in range.
Constraint check is false - not invoked

This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the contents of the clipboard match a specified text string.\10\10This constraint can only work on Android 10+ if you have used the clipboard refresh action previously to update the latest known clipboard text in MacroDroid.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire or an action to run only when the dark theme is on/off on Android 10+.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the mobile data is on/off.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only on the specified days of the month.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only on the specified days of the week.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the device is locked/unlocked.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the device is in portrait/landscape mode
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when connected/not connected to an external power source.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the device is facing in a particular physical orientations.

This constraint can be used to allow/prevent functionality based on the user\'s location (if they are inside or outside a defined location area).\10\10Due to the background location update rate, there may be some lag between entering/exiting an area and this constraint returning the correct value.
Please be aware that the location only updates periodically in the background and there may be some delay between entering/exiting an area and this constraint returning the correct value.
Set constraint to true if no location is available
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when GPS is enabled/disabled.\10\10On Android 5.0+ it is recommended to use the Location Mode constraint instead.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the headphones are connected/not connected.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when a cellular call is active/not active.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent functionality based on the current IP Address of the device.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run only when the device has been ADB hacked.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the mobile is/is not currently roaming.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when running on a rooted/non-rooted device.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent a macro being invoked if one or more specific macros have/have not recently been run.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the light sensor detects a value less than or greater than a defined value.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the location mode is set to a specific value

This constraint may be used to perform logical operators on any child constraints that are added to this constraint.\10\10To add child constraint(s) tap the constraint in the edit macro screen and select the \'add constraint\' option. All child constraints will appear indented directly under this constraint.

Logic constraints work by adding other constraints as children of the logic constraint. For example if you want to combine two constraints with an OR condition, add both constraints as children of the logic constraint.\10\10To add child constraints, tap on the logic constraint and select Add constraint.
This constraint can be used to allow something to happen only when the specified macro(s) are enabled or disabled.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when a MacroDroid variable is set to a particular value.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when in a specific MacroDroid mode.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when in the selected months.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when music is playing or not playing.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when NFC is enabled or disabled.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when a notification from a particular app is present or not present in the status bar.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire based on the state of the notification volume being on or off.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when a Pebble smart watch is connected/not connected.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the phone is ringing/not ringing.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the priority mode is in a certain state.

This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the proximity sensor is in the near/far state. Please note that this trigger will only work when the device\'s screen is on unless you modify the setting via the MacroDroid trigger settings
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the mobile roaming is enabled/disabled.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the device\'s screen is on/off.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the mobile service is available/not available.

This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run based on the enabled state of the speaker phone.\10\10Note that the speakerphone will only ever be classed as on when a call is in progress.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run if the time is before or after sunset/sunrise within a day.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run based on the current value of a system setting.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the current time is within the specified time period.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent a macro being invoked depending on how long the device has been booted.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run depending on the current state of the torch.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run depending on what trigger invoked the macro.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire based on the state of the ringer volume.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire based on the volume level of a specific audio stream.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run depending if the device is currently connected to a VPN (Virtual Private Network) or not
The wifi state could not be changed due to a problem with your wifi driver. This is most likely due to a problem in a custom ROM.

This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the Wifi connection is in a specific state.\10\10You can specify that either the Wifi is on or off, or alternatively that the device is/is not connected to a particular network.
This constraint can be used to allow a trigger to fire only when the wifi hotspot is enabled/disabled.
Wifi must be enabled to get a list of configured networks.\10\10Select OK to enable Wifi.

This constraint can be used to allow/prevent functionality based on what caused the macro to be invoked. For example if it was invoked from the MacroDroid drawer, or via an option dialog.\10\10Please note that this constraint should be used on individual triggers and actions (or within If conditions) not on the whole macro level.
This constraint can be used to allow/prevent actions being run based on the current value of the selected stopwatch.

An action is something your device can do when a macro runs. A macro must have at least one action to be valid.

Constraints are optional and can be used to allow or prevent a macro/action from running based on certain conditions. A macro/action will only run if the constraint condition is true.\10\10You can add constraints to individual triggers and actions from the \'Edit Macro\' screen.
A trigger is an instantaneous event that your device can detect to make a macro run. A macro must have at least one trigger to be valid.

When reporting a bug please ensure you are running the latest version of MacroDroid and you have taken the time to test the issue as much as possible.\10\10Many reported bugs are actually just badly configured macros or a misunderstanding of how a feature works. To help you debug please check your system log and long press on any feature to get help information.\10\10Please use the forums for all other purposes such as general help or feature requests.

A newer version of MacroDroid is available on the Google Play store. Please ensure you are running the latest version before reporting a bug.

All translations are crowd sourced via the OneSkyApp service. If you would like to contribute to the translation effort in your language please sign up via the link below. All contributions are greatly appreciated.
You can now enable real time auto translation in the template store. The setting can be toggled from the menu at the top right.
Set a confidence value required to invoke the trigger. A low value may result in more false triggers and a high value may prevent the trigger from firing in some situations.

This trigger will fire when the device detects you are performing a particular activity with the specified certainty level.\10\10In most cases you will want to use the greater than value to detect an activity has started. Using a less than value can be used to detect when an activity has probably finished.
This trigger will fire when the device is put into or taken out of Airplane mode.

This trigger can be used to invoke a Macro from the Android Wear MacroDroid app. It may also be used to trigger a macro when an Android Wear device connects/disconnects.\10\10This feature requires the MacroDroid Android Wear companion app to be installed on the watch.\10\10To install the companion app open the Play Store app on the watch and select \'Apps on your phone\'
This trigger will fire when an application is installed, removed or updated on the device.
This trigger will fire when an application becomes the foreground application (launched) or when it is no longer the foreground app (closed)
This trigger will fire when the auto rotate setting on the device changes.
This trigger will fire when the auto sync setting on the device changes.

This trigger will fire when the battery level increases or decreases to the selected level.\10\10Note that it will only fire once when the level transitions to the new state, not on every subsequent level change where the option remains true.
This trigger will fire when the battery saver state is enabled/disabled
This trigger will fire when the battery temperature increases or decreases to the selected level.
This trigger will fire when you come within range of a Bluetooth beacon.
This trigger will fire when the Bluetooth state changes.\10\10You can configure it to fire when Bluetooth is enabled or disabled, or when connected to/disconnected from a specific device.
This trigger will fire whenever the device completes booting.

This trigger will fire when a specific calendar event starts/ends.\10\10Please note that this trigger will typically only fire on 5 minute boundaries, so if you have an event that starts between boundaries it may trigger a few minutes later.
This trigger will fire when a call is actively in progress.
This trigger will fire when a call is ended.
This trigger will fire when a missed call occurs
Enter a name for the cell towers that will help you identify this location.
This trigger will fire when it detects that a particular cell tower or group of cell towers is in/out of range.

Scanning cell towers in range. If possible move around the local area while scanning and allow the device to scan for as long as possible. For best results it is strongly recommended that you allow your device to run an extended background scan for as long as possible.
This trigger will fire when the value stored in the clipboard is updated.
Enter text to match (leave blank for any)
This trigger will fire when the device\'s dark theme is enabled or disabled.
This trigger will fire when the data connectivity state changes.\10\10The device is considered to be connected if it has either a wifi or mobile data connection.
This trigger will fire on certain day of the week or day of the month
This trigger will fire when the Daydream mode turns on or off.
This trigger will fire when the screen is unlocked.

This trigger will fire when you dial the specified number in the standard phone dialler.\10\10By default the call will be stopped when the number is dialled, but you may configure the trigger to allow the call to continue.
This trigger will fire when the device is docked/undocked.\10\10For docking events, you can also specify the type of dock (desk or car).
This trigger will fire when the MacroDroid drawer is opened or closed.
This trigger will never fire of its own accord. It can be used for a macro that you want to invoke only with the \"Run Macro\" action.
This trigger will fire when the device is connected to or disconnected from an external power source.

This trigger will fire whenever an incorrect passcode (not fingerprint) is entered on the lock screen.\10\10Note that this trigger will only fire when a legal login attempt is made (for example a 3 digit pin is not allowed so will not cause this trigger to fire).

This trigger will fire when making the selected gesture on the fingerprint sensor.\10\10Please note that not all devices will support this trigger, because some devices do not implement the standard Android fingerprint gesture APIs.

This trigger will fire when you flip the device over from face up to face down or vice versa.\10\10Please note that this trigger will only work when the devices screen is on unless you modify the value within the application settings.

This trigger will display a floating button on the screen that can be pressed to activate a macro.\10\10To show and hide the button, the macro (or trigger) should be enabled or disabled accordingly. Dragging the button over the bin icon will result in the macro or trigger being disabled (as configured).
This trigger will fire when you enter or exit a specified area.\10\10It is equivalent to the Location Trigger but uses the standard Android Geofence APIs so may work better and/or use less battery.

This trigger can be used for macros that you invoke with Google Assistant (Ok Google). Note that this trigger is not strictly required as all macros may be triggered by the Google Assistant using the phrase \'Ok Google run macro-name in MacroDroid\'.\10\10You can use this trigger in macros that have multiple triggers in order to determine if it was the Google Assistant that invoked the macro (e.g. for use with the trigger that invoked constraint).
This trigger will fire when GPS is turned on/off.
This trigger will fire when headphones are connected or removed from the device.
This trigger will fire when you long press on the home button.\10\10Note that this trigger requires MacroDroid to be configured as the default assist and voice input app.
This trigger will fire when the hotspot functionality is enabled/disabled.

This trigger will fire when an incoming call is received.\10\10You can specify a particular contact that the incoming call should be from, or alternatively you can specify that the call should be from Any Contact, a Non Contact or Any Number.

This trigger will fire when an incoming sms is received.\10\10You can specify a particular contact that the incoming sms should be from, or alternatively you can specify that the message should be from Any Contact, a Non Contact or Any Number.\10\10You can also match against the incoming text content so the trigger will only fire when the sms text matches or contains the required text.\10\10Note that this trigger only works with real SMS messages (it\'s not possible to detect RCS/Chat messages)

This trigger will fire when an intent with the specified action is fired by another application.\10\10You can also pattern match against one or more extra parameter values, as well as store these values into variables.
This trigger will fire whenever the locally assigned IP Address is updated.
By default the light sensor will only work when the screen is on. You may configure the trigger via the settings to allow periodic background updates (but this will impact battery life).
This trigger will fire on a change to the light sensor, when the value goes above/below a certain value.
This trigger can be used to fire when a Tasker/Locale plugin has its condition met.

This trigger will fire when you enter or exit a specified area.\10\10Note that the location trigger will use GPS functionality (if enabled) and therefore may cause significant battery drain. You can configure the location update rate in the application settings to achieve a suitable compromise between accuracy and battery drain.

This will create an overlay button that you can use to start and stop logcat message capture at an appropriate time on your device.\10\10To minimize the number of messages captured, you should navigate to where you want to capture, start the capture, perform whatever functionality you desire and then stop capturing as soon as possible.\10\10After capturing you will be able to select a logcat entry for use in this trigger.

The Logcat output is a device wide logging mechanism that logs key system events and errors.\10\10This trigger will fire when the specified Logcat message content is seen within the device\'s Logcat output.

This trigger will fire whenever this macro is enabled.\10\10This can happen when the macro is manually switched on, enabled via another macro, enabled via the category being turned on or via MacroDroid being turned on.
This trigger will fire when MacroDroid is fully initialised.
Note that some devices such as Xiaomi AirDots may map a double press on the device to the long press option in MacroDroid.
This trigger will fire when the media button (on the headphones) is pressed between 1-3 times.
This trigger will fire when a media button such as play/stop/skip is pressed.
This trigger will fire when a particular MacroDroid mode is entered/exited.
This trigger will fire when music or sound playback is started or stopped.
This trigger will fire when the device starts/stops roaming.

This trigger will fire when an NFC tag is detected.\10\10When configuring the trigger you will be asked to give the tag a name and then be prompted to scan an NFC tag to configure it.\10\10Note that the NFC tag\'s data will be overwritten and any existing data on the tag will be erased.
This trigger will fire when the associated button is pressed in the notification button bar.
Select OK to configure your notification buttons.

This trigger will fire when a notification is received. You can add additional filters based on the application the notification has come from and the content of the notification text.\10\10By using this trigger in conjunction with the Speak Text action you can speak the incoming notification text.
This trigger will fire when the screen switches to portrait or landscape orientation.

This trigger will fire when an outgoing call is placed.\10\10You can specify a particular contact that the outgoing call is to, or alternatively you can specify that the call can be to Any Contact, a Non Contact or Any Number.

This trigger will fire when one of the following happens: a button is pressed on the MacroDroid Pebble watch application, the watch connects/disconnectes from the device or the pebble battery level changes to a certain value.
This trigger will fire when the power button is toggled the specified number of times.\10\10On some devices you must leave a slight delay between each press, else the press may not register.
This trigger will fire when the device\'s Priority Mode / Do Not Disturb state is changed.

This trigger will fire on a change to the proximity sensor.\10\10Please note that this trigger will only work when the device\'s screen is on unless you modify the setting via the MacroDroid trigger settings.
This trigger will add a quick settings tile to your notification panel to allow you to launch a macro.
This trigger will fire whenever the recent apps/task switcher screen is launched

This trigger will fire at a regular interval (e.g. every hour).\10\10You can also specify a reference start time that the interval should be relative to. For instance if you want a regular interval to occur exactly on the hour, you should specify a reference start time on the hour.

This trigger will fire when certain textual content appears on screen. Note that this trigger may not work for all apps/screen content as often text will be non-readable (for example if rendered within a game).
This trigger will fire when the screen is turned on or off.
This trigger will fire when you shake the device. Note that by default this trigger will only operate when the device\'s screen is on unless configured in the application trigger specific settings.

This trigger will enable an application shortcut for this macro. The trigger will be invoked whenever the appropriate shortcut is launched.\10\10This trigger enables you to invoke actions from other apps/launchers which support launching shortcuts.
This trigger will fire when the cellular signal is established/lost.
This trigger will fire when the device is put into or taken out of silent mode.\10\10Silent mode is when the ringer volume is set to zero.
This trigger will fire when a SIM card is inserted/removed.

Android sleep tracking creates a confidence value (0–100) to indicate how certain it is that you are asleep.\10\10You can adjust the confidence threshold values below to indicate when the trigger will fire a wake up or fall asleep event.

This trigger will fire when the phone determines that you have fallen asleep or woken up (as selected).\10\10This trigger relies on Android\'s activity recognition feature to determine when you fall asleep and wake up and may not be very accurate on some devices.\10\10You can adjust the awake/asleep thresholds to find a value that works best for your device.
It is recommended to use a time of day constraint with this trigger to avoid false triggers during the day (for example when you put your phone down and leave the room).
This trigger will fire when an outgoing SMS has been successfully sent.\10\10You can restrict the trigger so it will only fire when an SMS is sent to a specific contact and/or contains specific text.
This trigger will fire when a Stopwatch hits the configured time value.
This trigger will fire at sunrise or sunset for the chosen location.
Please select the location that you wish to use for the sunset/sunrise trigger.\10\10You can change the location later via the MacroDroid settings.
This trigger will fire when a specific swipe action is performed on the screen.
This trigger can be configured to fire at a certain time of day on selected days of the week.
This trigger will fire when a USB device such as a memory stick or keyboard is connected or disconnected.

This trigger will fire when a MacroDroid variable is set to a certain value.\10\10Note that when comparing less than or greater than, the trigger will only fire once when the value transitions into this state (not on subsequent updates where that same condition is still met)

This trigger will fire when you press the volume up or down button on the device. In most cases the trigger will only work when the screen is on (Monitoring volume changes works with screen off if the device is awake, eg. when playing music).\10\10You can choose to allow the volume to update or retain the previous volume when pressed.\10\10It is recommended you use this action with constraints, as interfering with the devices volume controls at all times is not recommended.
This trigger will fire when you long press the volume up or down button on the device. Unlike the standard Volume Button trigger this trigger should fire even when the screen is off.
This action uses a private API that could be blocked in future versions of Android or by future updates to MacroDroid (due to build tool changes).
This trigger will fire when the a VPN (Virtual Private Network) is connected/disconnected.

This trigger will fire based on the current weather conditions and requires a network connection to obtain periodic weather updates.\10\10Weather information is obtained from http://openweathermap.org.
Please select the location that you wish to use for weather updates.\10\10You can change the location later via the MacroDroid settings.
Move and zoom to an area, select the \"Set Location\" button and tap the map to set the location.

This trigger will fire on this device when the specified web URL is called from anywhere.\10\10Note that the URL is unique to this device and the URL will change if the app is ever reinstalled (or all app data is cleared).\10\10Google Play services must be available on the device for this feature to work, as it relies on Firebase Cloud Messaging to function.\10\10https://medium.com/@macrodroid/introducing-the-webhook-trigger-a760e2ee140d
To set a dictionary/array entry use round brackets in the url (instead of standard square brackets). For example: dictionary(entry)=value
MacroDroid variables can be set by passing URL query parameters. For example:\10\10http://trigger.macrodroid.com/deviceId/identifier?intparam=42&strParam=sometext

This trigger will fire when the corresponding MacroDroid widget button is pressed.\10\10There are four default coloured buttons provided, and you can configure custom button by selecting an icon and label.\10\10MacroDroid widgets can be added to your home screen via the normal mechanism.\10\10Only one widget button trigger may be added per macro.
This trigger will fire when a particular wifi network goes in or out of range.
Note that on Android 6 and above, location services must remain enabled on your device for this trigger to function.

This trigger will fire when the wifi state changes.\10\10You can configure it to fire when wifi is enabled or disabled, or when connected to/disconnected from a specific network.\10\10Please note that since Android 8.1 this functionality requires location permission and location services enabled in order to detect connect/disconnect events.
We are having trouble connecting to our servers.
The following macros require the MacroDroid FINGERPRINT accessibility service enabled via your device\'s settings.
The following macros require the MacroDroid accessibility service enabled via your device\'s settings.

On a small number of devices there can be noticeable slowdown when enabling particular accessibility services. This is caused by the system and not MacroDroid specifically.\10\10To minimize the impact, MacroDroid has multiple accessibility services for certain features, so please ensure you only enable the accessibility service(s) required. If slowdown continues then you should disable the offending accessibility services and stop using feature(s) that requires it.
System slows down after enabling accessibility services

MacroDroid has no control over enabling/disabling Accessibility services so this is a result of your manufacturer\'s OS disabling the service. This usually happens due to aggressive battery management. Information on how to disable this for many devices can be found at dontkillmyapp.com\10\10MacroDroid now has a feature where it can attempt to auto-restart disabled services, you can access/configure this via the MacroDroid settings or by clicking below.

The most common cause of this problem is simply that the volume stream used for speaking text is set to zero. If this is the case you should see an error in your system log indicating your volume is zero.\10\10If this is not the problem then you should check that your device\'s text to speech engine is working correctly, because MacroDroid relies on this to output speech.
The following macros require the MacroDroid UI INTERACTION accessibility service enabled via your device\'s settings.
The following macros require the MacroDroid VOLUME BUTTON accessibility service enabled via your device\'s settings.

Some Devices and OS versions have custom behaviour that will aggressively kill background services even if they are designed to always persist. You can find good advice on configuring a wide range of device types at dontkillmyapp.com

Some Device manufacturers put additional restrictions into the Operating System to prevent apps starting on boot up unless explicitly enabled. If you are experiencing this issue you can typically find an option in your device\'s settings app to allow this.
You currently have battery optimization enabled for MacroDroid, this may cause MacroDroid to be killed when running in the background.

Some devices such as Huawei and Xiaomi will show a custom prompt when trying to enable bluetooth from an application.\10\10On Xiaomi devices this can be modified with a setting typically found in \'Other permissions\' called bluetooth connectivity. On Huawei devices there is no option to disable this prompt and its only possible by faking UI presses with the UI Interaction action (only when screen is on).

Due to changes mandated by Google it is sadly no longer possible to create a borderless notification on Android 12 and above, so the button bar can no longer occupy the full width and height of the notification area.
If you have enabled device admin access you will be unable to uninstall MacroDroid in the standard way unless you first disable it. Click below to uninstall the app directly.
\'Don\'t keep activities\' is enabled in your developer options. This can prevent some UI configuration screens from functioning and cause other system issues.
Every trigger, action and constraint has help information available. To display this information please long-press on an item when selecting from the trigger, action and constraint list screens.
The force hide icon option is enabled which is known to cause issues in some cases with MacroDroid being killed in the background.\10\10Please disable this option to improve application stability.

The Geofence functionality is provided by Google Play services. In some situations the Play services library can get into a broken state in which case the Play Services application requires its data to be cleared and the device rebooted.\10\10If the trigger consistently fails then please consider using the Location trigger as an alternative which does not use Google Play services.

Certain triggers that wake the device up regularly (such as location trigger) may result in increased battery drain.\10\10It is recommended to use long update rates and disable macros with such triggers at times where you don\'t need them to be active.

The UI Interaction functionality relies on an accessibility service in order to identify controls on the screen to interact with.\10\10In some cases this accessibility service can get disabled or into a broken state. Please ensure the MacroDroid UI Interaction accessibility service is enabled and try rebooting your device if it is already enabled.

MacroDroid runs as a foreground service which means it displays a persistent notification by default. On Android 8+ you can choose to hide only the persistent notification channel.\10\10It is strongly recommended not to hide all notifications as you may lose access to important information such as missing permissions or other essential troubleshooting details.
The link(s) below will attempt to take you to a relevant config screen on your device, but may not work in some cases.
The following macros require the %s permission.

Android may now auto disable application permissions for background apps after a few months unless you explicitly disabled this feature. This option is typically found at the bottom of the permissions list on most devices. If the option appears disabled and cannot be toggled, then the behaviour will not apply and you can safely hide this warning.

The Pro upgrade should be auto applied to the app when it is installed from an account that has previously purchased via the Play Store.\10\10If the upgrade fails to apply, firstly please ensure that you have installed from the correct account. If so please try clearing the storage of the Play Store application and rebooting your device which will usually solve this issue.
Due to new restrictions in Android, file access is now more limited and the following macros require reconfiguration of the %s action.

The UI Interaction action works by using an accessibility service to identify standard Android UI components to interact with. Most games are typically custom drawn onto a canvas so cannot be interacted with in this way.\10\10MacroDroid is not intended as a tool for manipulating games, therefore it is recommended to look for an alternative app if this is your main use case.
UI Interaction does not work in games

In order to detect Wifi SSID names and Cell Tower Ids, it is now required on recent Android versions to have both location permission granted and location services enabled.\10\10Full details of this requirement can be seen in the link below.
Why do I need location services enabled?

Due to enforced changes in Android some features such as setting Wifi can no longer be performed directly in MacroDroid.\10\10A MacroDroid helper application distributed away from the Play Store can be built against an older SDK version which enables additional functionality to be performed.\10\10Related information can be found here: https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/128554616
Why do I need a helper app?
Please try an alternative mechanism if the feature is not working for you.
Usage of the @ tag is no longer allowed in order to prevent spamming. Please ensure you always adhere to Twitter\'s terms and conditions.
Both input and output Uri must be specified
Therefore, override color resource (ucrop_color_toolbar_widget) in your app to make it work on pre-L devices
Navigate to the appropriate app screen, touch the notification and then press the UI control on the screen.
Please add at least one swipe
MacroDroid was unable to contact the Play Store to request a purchase. If the problem persists please try uninstalling and download the app again from the Play Store.

The template store contains user generated content and is therefore subject to terms of use as defined below.

Users are prohibited from uploading objectionable content. Any user who is found to breach this policy will have the content removed and may be subject to account banning without warning. Objectionable content is defined as any content that may cause harm, offence or an otherwise negative experience for other users.

Examples of objectionable content are (but not limited to): Prejudicial text (racism, sexism etc.). Macros designed for malicious purposes or to cause undesired effects to users who download them. Any content related to pornography or other inappropriate adult only content.

A user can report any macro with objectionable content can be reported via the \'Report Macro\' option via the menu available on any expanded macro. This will then be subject to review and will later be removed if deemed objectionable.
Individual macros with unwanted content can be blocked via the \'Block Macro\' option via the menu available on any expanded macro.
Content from individual users may be blocked via the \'Block User\' option via the menu available on any expanded macro.
The user log can be used to log user defined content during the execution of a macro. Use the action “Log Event” to write new content to the log

Define one or more array indexes manually using the full syntax. For example to address a 2d array you could write [3][10]
To force an array type (rather than dictionary) prefix the index with _A_. For example to output a value in a 2d array you could write [_A_3][_A_10]
Define one or more dictionary keys manually using the full syntax. For example to address a dictionary storing data by years and months you could write [2022][May]

Variables can be used to store values (numbers, text strings and true/false conditions). These values can be set in the Macrodroid action “Set variable”.\10\10Variables can be used throughout the app as Triggers and Conditions, and can be used for controlling specific Macrodroid and system settings.
